 Senior Programmer Analyst Informix Software, Inc. May 1992  –  July 2001  (9 years 3 months) Menlo Park, CA - Provided application support for Informix employees worldwide. 
- Designed, coded, tested, and maintained applications written in Informix-4GL, Informix-ESQL/C, SAP ABAP, and SAPscript.

 Member Technical Staff CSC - Computer Sciences Corporation July 1988  –  October 1991  (3 years 4 months) Bridgewater, NJ - Worked as a contractor to Bell Laboratories and AT&T. 
- Designed, coded, tested, and maintained applications written in Informix-4GL, Informix-ESQL/C, Bourne Shell, C, ESCORT (AT&T connectivity software), and Interactive System Productivity (ISPF). 
- Assisted a Quality Assurance group with testing. Created spreadsheets using LOTUS 1-2-3 to aid the group with checking the calculations performed by the application. 
- Created documentation for all application worked on. 
- Used personal computers, mainframes, and UNIX systems to complete assignments.

Experience Business Consultant III (supporting the Coca-Cola Company) Metasys Technologies, Inc. (Assigned to Coca-Cola, CBS) January 2015  – Present (8 months) Assigned to CONA project, insuring that all affected EDI transactions are setup correctly with the conversion of the backend system to SAP for my assigned customers within each bottler's territory. Test each new setup and trouble shoot any issues related to the switch over. EDI Mapping Consultant (Contractor) Thomas & Betts January 2014  –  December 2014  (1 year) Memphis, TN I was the sole mapping contractor hired for a major conversion of hundreds of maps from mainframe Gentran to WDI 3.3 for z/os. I completed over 380 maps during my one year contract. I mentored the clients' EDI team and shared tips and tricks for WDI mapping. At the end of my contract, the migration project was eight months AHEAD OF SCHEDULE. GXS - AI Developer (Contractor) The Coca-Cola Company September 2013  –  December 2013  (4 months) Analysis, Mapping, and Implementation of Bottler/Customer EDI transactions using AI, TradeGuide, webMethods, UltraEdit, Unix, EDISIM, and HP Quality Center. Senior Consultant Cognosante June 2013  –  August 2013  (3 months) Assigned to the Center for Consumer Information and Insurance Oversight (CCIIO) Error Resolution and Reconciliation (ERR) project, supporting 834 fallout from enrollment in Exchanges created as a result of the Affordable Care Act. Sr. Technical Analyst (EDI) GXS April 2005  –  June 2013  (8 years 3 months) Develop new AI maps and specs concurrently on new AI Converge tool (including HIPAA map that updates a Sybase database directly); work closely with AI Engineering on requirements for Converge as well as function as the main internal beta tester for the product; created most of the current User’s guide for AI Converge; analyze and evaluate customer requirements; function as consultant as needed for specific clients who are not EDI savvy; write detailed mapping specifications for the offshore Mapping Team to develop AI maps (including 834 and 837 HIPAA transactions); create EDI implementation guides for clients; make minor production map changes as needed in AI; test maps on a Unix environment; mentor new analysts; functioned as lead EDI Analyst for large conversion project moving legacy IBM clients to GXS Managed Services after the sale to GXS; approve mapping packages delivered by Mapping Team before integration to preproduction; make minor corrections as necessary to AI maps delivered by Mapping Team; reverse-engineer map specs from production maps; primary backup for first-line manager. Advisory Applications Programmer IBM Global Services May 1998  –  April 2005  (7 years) Duel role of EDI mapper and JCL developer for IBM’s In-Network Translation service; lead developer of HIPAA validation maps using new WebSphere Data Interchange release version 3.2; published white paper on WDI Validation Mapping 9/2003; technical presenter at DI User’s Conference 2002; created EANCOM97 standard files and validation maps from specifications for WDI Development for use with WDI 3.2; mapped various inbound and outbound EDI transactions using both ANSI X12 and EDIFACT standards as well as any to any translations including XML, using the DataInterchange 3.1 host version for MVS and the client version; developed JCL to fit customer-specific needs; participated in WDI Development code reviews Spring 2005 to lend customer perspective on planned upgrades; and maintained monthly problem ticket tracking for In-Network Translation. Prior Position at IBM: Software Engineer: Developer of the Expedite/CICS communications software allowing users to communicate with IBM’s Information Exchange (VAN); designed and developed the 4.5 release of Expedite/CICS using CICS IP Sockets Interface to add TCP/IP capabilities to the SNA communication software; provided third level technical support for current and previous releases of Expedite/CICS; ensured technical accuracy of the Expedite/CICS manuals and web page; created, tested, and packaged PTFs (program temporary fixes) when necessary. Consultant CBSI January 1998  –  May 1998  (5 months) Assigned to Equifax on the Y2K project, using COBOL and JCL to update their financial programs to be Y2K compliant on an MVS platform. EDI Analyst / Inventory Control Adams Air & Hydraulics, Inc. 1995  –  1997  (2 years) Responsible for testing with and adding all new EDI trading partners; implemented the use of the 810, 820, and 855 transactions; responsible for inventory accuracy and organization; biweekly cycle counting of inventory; ongoing training of purchasing personnel; back-up purchasing duties.
